libraries.name: Alameda County Library
libraries.description: County system with 11 branches serving Albany, Dublin, Fremont, Newark, Union City, and unincorporated areas

libraries.name: Alameda Free Library
libraries.description: City-operated library; not part of the county library system

libraries.name: Berkeley Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library; not part of the county system

libraries.name: Oakland Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library serving Oakland and also providing library services to Emeryville and Piedmont

libraries.name: Hayward Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: Livermore Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: Pleasanton Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: San Leandro Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: Contra Costa County Library
libraries.description: County library with 26 branches serving various communities

libraries.name: Richmond Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library independent of the county system. County library cards and Richmond library cards are not interchangeable.

marin.name: Marin County

libraries.name: Marin County Free Library
libraries.description: County library system with 10 branch libraries across Marin

libraries.name: Belvedere-Tiburon Library
libraries.description: Community library funded by the Town of Tiburon and City of Belvedere, not part of the county system

libraries.name: Larkspur Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: Mill Valley Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: San Anselmo Public Library
libraries.description: Town-operated library

libraries.name: San Rafael Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library with multiple branches in San Rafael

libraries.name: Sausalito Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

marin.notes: A Marin County Library card is generally accepted at all these city libraries through cooperative agreements.

libraries.name: Napa County Library
libraries.description: County-wide library system with branches in the City of Napa, American Canyon, Calistoga, and Yountville. Also known as Napa City-County Library.

libraries.name: St. Helena Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library in St. Helena, established in 1894 and independent of the Napa County Library system. Issues its own library cards.

libraries.name: San Francisco Public Library
libraries.description: Unified city-county library system serving San Francisco. Operates the Main Library at Civic Center and over two dozen branch libraries.

san-mateo.name: San Mateo County

libraries.name: San Mateo County Libraries
libraries.description: County library district operating 12 branch libraries, governed by a Joint Powers Authority. Branches include Atherton, Belmont, Brisbane, East Palo Alto, Foster City, Half Moon Bay, Millbrae, Portola Valley, San Carlos, Woodside, and the Pacifica libraries.

libraries.name: Burlingame Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: Daly City Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library with multiple branches in Daly City

libraries.name: Menlo Park Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: Redwood City Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library with 3 branches in Redwood City

libraries.name: San Bruno Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: San Mateo Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library with a main library and branches in San Mateo

libraries.name: South San Francisco Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library with main and branch locations in South San Francisco

san-mateo.notes: Library services are provided through the Peninsula Library System (PLS), which includes SMCL and independent city libraries that share resources.

libraries.name: Santa Clara County Library District
libraries.description: County library district with 8 branch libraries, serving Campbell, Cupertino, Gilroy, Los Altos, Milpitas, Morgan Hill, Saratoga, Los Altos Hills, Monte Sereno, and unincorporated areas. Headquarters in Campbell.

libraries.name: San Jose Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library system with 25+ branches, including the Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Library which is jointly operated with San Jose State University.

libraries.name: Santa Clara City Library
libraries.description: City-operated library system in Santa Clara, CA

libraries.name: Mountain View Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: Palo Alto City Library
libraries.description: City-operated library system in Palo Alto

libraries.name: Sunnyvale Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library

libraries.name: Los Gatos Library
libraries.description: Town-operated library

libraries.name: Solano County Library
libraries.description: County library system with 9 branches, serving Dixon, Fairfield, Rio Vista, Suisun City, Vacaville, Vallejo, and adjacent unincorporated areas. Major branches include Fairfield's Civic Center Library and the JFK Library in Vallejo.

libraries.name: Benicia Public Library
libraries.description: City-operated library; Benicia's library is independent of the Solano County Library system. Issues its own library cards. Partners in the SPLASH consortium.

sonoma.name: Sonoma County

libraries.name: Sonoma County Library
libraries.description: County-wide public library system (a joint powers authority) serving all nine cities in Sonoma County – Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Rohnert Park, Sonoma, Healdsburg, Sebastopol, Windsor, Cotati, Cloverdale – as well as unincorporated areas. Operates 13 branch libraries.

sonoma.notes: Since 1975, all public libraries in Sonoma County operate under one unified system. There are no separate city-run public libraries in Sonoma County.

academicLibraries.name: Stanford University Libraries
academicLibraries.description: Library system of Stanford University, encompassing 20+ libraries and millions of volumes

academicLibraries.name: UC Berkeley Libraries
academicLibraries.description: University of California, Berkeley's library system; one of the largest academic libraries in the U.S., with 26 libraries and over 14 million volumes

academicLibraries.name: UCSF Library
academicLibraries.description: University of California, San Francisco's academic health sciences library – a leading medical library

academicLibraries.name: San Jose State University Library (Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Library)
academicLibraries.description: Joint university and public library, serving as both SJSU's campus library and the main library of San Jose's public library system

academicLibraries.name: Santa Clara University Library
academicLibraries.description: Academic library of Santa Clara University

academicLibraries.name: San Francisco State University - J. Paul Leonard Library
academicLibraries.description: Academic library of SFSU, serving students and faculty on campus

academicLibraries.name: Cal State East Bay Library
academicLibraries.description: University Library of California State University, East Bay

academicLibraries.name: Sonoma State University Library (Jean and Charles Schulz Information Center)
academicLibraries.description: Academic library of Sonoma State University

academicLibraries.name: University of San Francisco - Gleeson Library
academicLibraries.description: Academic library of USF, a private university in San Francisco

lawLibraries.name: UC Hastings College of the Law Library (UC Law SF Library)
lawLibraries.description: Law library supporting UC Law San Francisco, open to students and the public for legal research

lawLibraries.name: San Francisco Law Library
lawLibraries.description: Public law library for San Francisco, offering legal resources to the public

lawLibraries.name: Alameda County Law Library
lawLibraries.description: Public law library serving Alameda County's legal research needs

medicalLibraries.name: Lane Medical Library
medicalLibraries.description: Stanford University's medical library, serving Stanford Medicine

specialLibraries.name: California Academy of Sciences Library
specialLibraries.description: Special library focusing on natural sciences, at the California Academy of Sciences museum in Golden Gate Park
